name: Avoid setting field values using hard-coded values (Siebel)
description: With the current code implementation fields are set by using hard-coded values.
output: This rule reports Functions setting field values with hard-coded values
rationale: Fields are set using hard-coded values instead of LOV values.
remediation: Change the code retrieving values based on LOV type using TheApplication().InvokeMethod("LookupValue",<TYPE>, <LANG INDEPENDEND CODE>);
total: Number of added or modified eScripts
alternativeName: Avoid setting field values using hard-coded values (Siebel)

technicalCriteria.name: ASCMM-MNT-3 - Storable and Member Data Element Initialization with Hard-Coded Literals
CWE-1052: Excessive Use of Hard-Coded Literals in Initialization

qualityStandards.name: Storable and Member Data Element Initialization with Hard-Coded Literals
qualityStandards.description:
Objective
Avoid hard-coded non-trivial values in the code

Consequence
Software featuring hard-coded pieces of information within its own code reduces adaptability

Measure Element
Number of instances where a literal value element is used to intialize a storable data element or member data element via a ‘Write’ action; exceptions are simple integers and static constant storable or member data elements

qualityStandards.name: Excessive Use of Hard-Coded Literals in Initialization
qualityStandards.description: The software initializes a data element using a hard-coded literal that is not a simple integer or static constant element.
